medical_history.chief_complaint: Epigastric pain with associated nausea and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Gradual onset of sharp, cramping epigastric/periumbilical pain over 1 day, improved by standing up but worsened when laying down. The patient experienced pain similar to appendicitis but noted it was not as painful. Symptoms included nausea and emesis of undigested food, with chills but no fever.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Perforated appendicitis, hypertension (diet-controlled), chronic bilateral hearing loss with speech impediment.
medical_history.family_history: Mother and sister had gallstones; notable for hypertension.
